1.brief: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

2.brief: to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply

a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion

to say (used with great latitude)

to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
